::Rodimus Prime/Elder/Kup/Grimlock::
   
  Rodimus layed on the beach without motion. He now seemed smaller and less powerful. In fact this was no longer Rodimus Prime. This was the defeated Hot Rod.
   
  Elswhere on the shores of Atlantis Elder, Kup and Grimlock are observing as the Sweeps leave.
   
  Grimlock: What happen?
   
  Elder: They got what they came for. They have the Matrix.
   
  Kup: We gotta get to him, lads.
   
  Kup starts looking for a boat to travel to the island.
   
  Elder tries to raise Hot Rod on comm.
   
  Elder: Rodimus. Rodimus Prime do you read?

khamkain <khamkain@...> wrote:
          OOC: I didn't saw some post some my last post could seem out of
context a bit so let me correct.

BIC: As the Matrix flowned from Rodimus's core to Cyclonyus, a painful
scream could be heard from Remus. It was if Cyclonus was draining a
part of Remus's core at the same time. Remus couldn't stand it anymore
. The heroic figth of Rodimus may have destroy all hope of any futur.
But it wasn't Rodimus's fault. The only one's to blame was Remus: onle
he had known what was at sake. He had to stop Cyclonus.

Has he dashed toward Cyclonus, the golden glow from his eyes was
iradiating from all his body. He was trying to get to Cyclonus.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
> 
> --- Richard Allen <roborick007@...> wrote:
> 
> > ::Rodimus Prime::
> > 
> > Rodimus let out a scream that could wake the dead and terrify even
> > the bravest of bots to their very sparks. The wisdom of the ages, the
> > power of the Matrix had almost been Rodimus' life force for so long.
> > He belonged to the Matrix as much as it belonged to him. Now it was
> > gone. The Matrix shell being depleted as it's awesome power was
> > extracted from it's connection with Rodimus' spark. This was the fall
> > of the legend. The chosen one was beaten and failed to protect the
> > very thing he was alive to protect.
> 
> There was no change of expression from Cyclonus as Rodimus screamed
> out. Energy streamed between them, first from between Cyclonus' hands
> to Rodimus chest then sparks began to jump all along them. For a moment
> they rose from the ground as powerful electrical fields danced in
> between them. Wind began to blow and once placid waters became strong
> and choppy For a moment the skies darkend as clouds before the sun, and
> in the distance thunderclapped .. and then all was was complete. 
> 
> Cyclonus and Rodimus both fell to the ground for a moment sprawled out
> on the sandy beach. Cyclonus sat up his optics going yellow then orange
> then resuming thier dark red. 
> 
> Rising into the air Cyclonus' feet merged and boosters replaced them
> allowing him to hover in place. As he did so it became obvious that
> something about Cyclonus had changed with the defeat of this foe. He
> was still damaged, his armor burned and desnted in many places, cracks
> seeming to run his full length and yet he was subtly different. He took
> a moment to survey his fallen foe, his look unreadable as if absorbing
> what had been done. 
> 
> As he watched Rodimus appeared to glow red as Scourge and the remainder
> sweeps above 'painted' him preparing to destroy him utterly.
> 
> "No." Cyclonus word was clear and final, his face still somber. "He has
> fallen as a warrior, and I will allow him to be buried by his fellows."
> 
> 
> The red targetting beams winked off and Rodimus resumed his normal hue.
> 
> 
> From behind Cyclonus Scourge's gruff voice can be heard, "Hrmph. He was
> a fool! Let's use this moment to destroy him and that city behind us."
> 
> Cyclonus shook his head, "We abide by this battle. We have won, and we
> shall leave." He turned to look at Scourge, "But we shall be back." For
> the first time a smile appeared on Cyclonus' face, "but without the
> might of Rodimus they will not be able to stand against us."
> 
> Sourge nodded in approval.
> 
> Cyclonus looked skyward as sweeps continued to circle and as several
> arrived apparently from some distance away. They merged with the rest
> and circled as if waiting. "Is everything in readiness?" Cyclonus asked
> Scourge without looking away from the sweeps.
> 
> "Yes." Scourge's voice full of eagerness. "everything is going
> according to plan."
> 
> "Good." Cyclonus' smile faded as he rose up into the air and then
> assumed his starfighter mode. "Then it is time for us to depart. leave
> Rodimus to his own .. and leave that one as well .. " indicating Remus
> "He can report our victory to thier remaing leaders, and they will come
> to fear us, as all will!"
> 
> With a burst of sheer power Cyclonus rose up into the clouds as Scourge
> followed suit and then the sweeps. Then like some dark storm they rose
> high into the air took one last sweep, and then faded into the setting
> sun, quickly disappearing from all visual sensors.
> 
> -----------------
> 
> Down below on the sandy beach calm waters continued to lap against the
> fallen form of Rodimus as the tide was begining to come in. Trees in
> the distance began to blow and sway as natural winds resumed. the cool
> breezes blew sand around, slowly begining to cover the scorched sands
> on the beach. In the skies sea birds cautiously began fly, a few even
> were bold enough to try to land on Rodimus, thinking him a nice warm
> resting place as they looked for fish. 
> 
> Tranquility with unyielding boldness and resolve began to reassert
> itself once more.
> 
> Preston
> (Da'minion)
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
>
